In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can write that function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end

    push!(lines, line) # add the remaining line to lines after the loop
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```
You can test this function using the following example:

```julia
str = "This is a test string for wrapping text. It will wrap at the end of every word."
println(wrap_string(str))
```
The output will be:

```
This is a test
string for 
wrapping text.
It will wrap
at the end of
every word.
```
